    • Method Detail

      • updateScrollElemLength

        protected void updateScrollElemLength()
        Set the length of the scroll element so that the ratio of the length of the scroll button to the width of the scrollbar equals the ratio of the width of the content area to the width of the content.
        Specified by:
        updateScrollElemLength in class Scrollbar

      • setWidth

        public void setWidth(int width)
        Set the width and update the step size.
        Overrides:
        setWidth in class Component
        Parameters:
        width - The new width of the component.
        Effects:
      • The setWidth() method of the Component class is called.
            super.setWidth(width)
      • The scrollbar's step size is set to 10% of the width.
            setStepSize(0.15 * (width - getScrollElemLength()))

      • setEnabled

        protected void setEnabled()
        Description copied from class: Scrollbar
        Enable or disable the scrollbar based on the contentSize.
        Specified by:
        setEnabled in class Scrollbar
        Postcondition:
        The scrollbar is enabled if the width is lower than the content size
            new.isEnabled() == getWidth() < getContentSize()

      • updateOffset

        protected void updateOffset()
        Change the offset to a new position determined by the scroll position.
        Specified by:
        updateOffset in class Scrollbar
        Effect:
        The setOffset method is called with the the percentage of the maxOffset that corresponds to the percentage of the scrollbar that is before the scroll element as argument.
            setOffset(getScrollPosition() / getWidth() * maxOffset)

      • setMaxOffset

        protected void setMaxOffset()
        Determine the maximum offset that is allowed.
        Specified by:
        setMaxOffset in class Scrollbar
        Postcondition:
        The new maximum offset is equal to the difference between the width of the content this scrollbar manages and the width of the scrollbar itself added with the margin on scrollbars.

        Overrides:
        setX in class Component

        Effects:
      • The setX() method of the superclass is called.

            dimensionsChanged()

      • isBeforeScrollElement

        protected boolean isBeforeScrollElement(int x,
                                        int y)
        Check if a coordinate pair is before of after the scroll element.
        Specified by:
        isBeforeScrollElement in class Scrollbar
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate for which to check.
        y - The y coordinate for which to check.
        Returns:
        True if the scroll element is before the specified pair, false otherwise.
